newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - IBM eases.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - IBM eases.

text.p: Shares in International Business Machines Corp eased before the markets' opening Tuesday after the computer maker released second quarter earnings.

Markets were quiet, and one trader said, "There's really not a lot of trading. People are focusing on earnings, and (Federal Reserve chairman Alan) Greenspan's testimony today" before Congress on economic and monetary policy.
IBM shares were trading at 101-1/2, down from a Monday close of 103-11/16. The company reported its quarterly results of $1.46 per share, $0.04 above analysts' views, after the markets' close Monday.

Among other active shares, McAfee Associates Inc was traded at 76-3/4 versus a close of 77-4/16. The Santa Clara, Calif., software company reported earnings of $0.44 a share after the markets' close Monday against $0.18 a year before.
PepsiCo Inc was slightly higher, trading at 35-3/4 versus a closing price of 35-8/16. The company reported second-quarter earnings per share of $0.42 against $0.36 for the same period a year before.
